Uses of ApiKeyBuilder in com.stormpath.sdk.client
 

Methods in com.stormpath.sdk.client that return ApiKeyBuilder
static ApiKeyBuilder ApiKeys.builder()
          Returns a new ApiKeyBuilder instance, used to construct ApiKey instances.
 ApiKeyBuilder ApiKeyBuilder.setFileLocation(String location)
          Sets the location of the .properties file to load containing the API Key (Id and secret) used by the Client to communicate with the Stormpath REST API.
 ApiKeyBuilder ApiKeyBuilder.setId(String id)
          Allows specifying the client's API Key id value directly instead of reading it from a stream-based resource (e.g.
 ApiKeyBuilder ApiKeyBuilder.setIdPropertyName(String idPropertyName)
          Sets the name used to query for the API Key ID from a Properties instance.
 ApiKeyBuilder ApiKeyBuilder.setInputStream(InputStream is)
          Creates an API Key Properties instance based on the specified InputStream instead of loading a .properties file via fileLocation configuration.
 ApiKeyBuilder ApiKeyBuilder.setProperties(Properties properties)
          Allows usage of a Properties instance instead of loading a .properties file via fileLocation configuration.
 ApiKeyBuilder ApiKeyBuilder.setReader(Reader reader)
          Creates an API Key Properties instance based on the specified Reader instead of loading a .properties file via fileLocation configuration.
 ApiKeyBuilder ApiKeyBuilder.setSecret(String secret)
          Allows specifying the client's API Key secret value directly instead of reading it from a stream-based resource (e.g.
 ApiKeyBuilder ApiKeyBuilder.setSecretPropertyName(String secretPropertyName)
          Sets the name used to query for the API Key Secret from a Properties instance.
